item.text: The following events happened in the days of Ahasuerus. (I am referring to that Ahasuerus who used to rule over 127 provinces extending all the way from India to Ethiopia.)

In <st data-num="01992" class="">those</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, as <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st> <st data-num="07675" class="">sat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="04438" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="03678 0834">throne</st> in <st data-num="07800" class="">Susa</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01002" class="">citadel</st>,<n id="2" />
in the third year of his reign he provided a banquet for all his officials and his servants. The army of Persia and Media was present, as well as the nobles and the officials of the provinces.
He displayed the riches of his royal glory and the splendor of his majestic greatness for a lengthy period of time—180 days, to be exact!

When <st data-num="0428" class="">those</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st><n id="1" /> were <st data-num="04390" class="">completed</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> then <st data-num="06213" class="">provided</st> a <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st>-<st data-num="03117" class="">day</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04960" class="">banquet</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> who were <st data-num="04672" class="">present</st><n id="3" /> in <st data-num="07800" class="">Susa</st> the <st data-num="01002" class="">citadel</st>, for those of <st data-num="01419" class="">highest standing</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06996" class="">most lowly</st>.<n id="4" /> It was held in the <st data-num="02691" class="">court</st> located in the <st data-num="01594" class="">garden</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01055" class="">palace</st>.

The furnishings included <st data-num="02353" class="">white</st> <st data-num="03768" class="">linen</st> and <st data-num="08504">blue</st> <st data-num="02353" class="">curtains</st> <st data-num="0270" class="">hung</st> by <st data-num="02256" class="">cords</st> of the <st data-num="0948" class="">finest linen</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0713" class="">purple wool</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="01550" class="">rings</st>, <st data-num="08336" class="">alabaster</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">columns</st>, <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> and <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> <st data-num="04296" class="">couches</st><n id="2" /> displayed <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> a <st data-num="07531" class="">floor</st> made of <st data-num="0923" class="">valuable stones</st> of <st data-num="08336" class="">alabaster</st>, <st data-num="01858" class="">mother-of-pearl</st>, and <st data-num="05508" class="">mineral stone</st>.

<st data-num="08248" class="">Drinks</st><n id="1" /> were served in <st data-num="02091" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">containers</st>, <st data-num="03627" class="">all of which</st> <st data-num="08138" class="">differed</st> from <st data-num="03627" class="">one another</st>. <st data-num="04438" class="">Royal</st> <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st> was available in <st data-num="07227" class="">abundance</st> at the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">expense</st>.

<st data-num="0369" class="">There were no</st> <st data-num="01881 0597">restrictions</st> on the <st data-num="08360" class="">drinking</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588 03651">for</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> had <st data-num="03245 05921">instructed</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="07227 01004">supervisors</st><n id="2" /> that they should <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> as <st data-num="0376 0376">everyone</st> so <st data-num="07522" class="">desired</st>.<n id="3" />
Queen Vashti also gave a banquet for the women in King Ahasuerus’ royal palace.
On the seventh day, as King Ahasuerus was feeling the effects of the wine, he ordered Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven eunuchs who attended him,

to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="04436" class="">Queen</st> <st data-num="02060" class="">Vashti</st> into the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">presence</st> wearing her <st data-num="04438" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="03804" class="">high turban</st>. He wanted to <st data-num="07200" class="">show</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and the <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> her <st data-num="03308" class="">beauty</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> was <st data-num="02896 04758">very attractive</st>.<n id="1" />
But Queen Vashti refused to come at the king’s bidding conveyed through the eunuchs. Then the king became extremely angry, and his rage consumed him.
The king then inquired of the wise men who were discerners of the times—for it was the royal custom to confer with all those who were proficient in laws and legalities.

Those who were <st data-num="07138" class="">closest</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him were <st data-num="03771" class="">Carshena</st>, <st data-num="08369" class="">Shethar</st>, <st data-num="0133" class="">Admatha</st>, <st data-num="08659" class="">Tarshish</st>, <st data-num="04825" class="">Meres</st>, <st data-num="04826" class="">Marsena</st>, and <st data-num="04462" class="">Memucan</st>. These men were the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> of <st data-num="06539" class="">Persia</st> and <st data-num="04074" class="">Media</st> who <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> the <st data-num="04428">king</st> <st data-num="06440">on a regular basis</st><n id="1" /> and had the most <st data-num="07223" class="">prominent</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">offices</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="04438" class="">kingdom</st>.
The king asked, “By law, what should be done to Queen Vashti in light of the fact that she has not obeyed the instructions of King Ahasuerus conveyed through the eunuchs?”

Memucan then replied to the king and the officials, “The wrong of Queen Vashti is not against the king alone, but against all the officials and all the people who are throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus.

<st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">matter</st> concerning the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> will <st data-num="03318" class="">spread</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st>, leading them to <st data-num="0959 05869">treat</st> their <st data-num="01167" class="">husbands</st> <st data-num="0959 05869">with contempt</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘When <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">gave orders</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="04436" class="">Queen</st> <st data-num="02060" class="">Vashti</st> into his <st data-num="06440" class="">presence</st>, she would <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st>.’

And <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> the <st data-num="08282" class="">noble ladies</st> of <st data-num="06539" class="">Persia</st> and <st data-num="04074" class="">Media</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> have <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">matter</st> concerning the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> will <st data-num="0559" class="">respond</st> in the same way to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st>, and there will be more than <st data-num="01767" class="">enough</st> <st data-num="0963" class="">contempt</st> and <st data-num="07110" class="">anger</st>.

<st data-num="0518 05921">If</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> is so <st data-num="02895" class="">inclined</st>,<n id="1" /> let a <st data-num="04438" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">edict</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">go forth</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> him, and let it be <st data-num="03789" class="">written</st> in the <st data-num="01881" class="">laws</st> of <st data-num="06539" class="">Persia</st> and <st data-num="04074" class="">Media</st> that <st data-num="03808" class="">cannot</st> be <st data-num="05674" class="">repealed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="02060" class="">Vashti</st><n id="3" /> may <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> into the <st data-num="06440" class="">presence</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st>, and let the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">convey</st> her <st data-num="04438" class="">royalty</st> to <st data-num="07468" class="">another</st><n id="4" /> who is more <st data-num="02896" class="">deserving</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">than</st> she.<n id="5" />

And let the king’s decision that he will enact be disseminated throughout all his kingdom, vast though it is. Then all the women will give honor to their husbands, from the most prominent to the lowly.”
The matter seemed appropriate to the king and the officials. So the king acted on the advice of Memucan.

He sent letters throughout all the royal provinces, to each province according to its own script and to each people according to their own language, that every man should be ruling his family and should be speaking the language of his own people.
